item.title: Report X-2025040583
item.description:
Report X-2025040583

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the INDH location a wooden skid was observed with a release. The skid contained seventeen plastic drums banded and shrink wrapped together. One of them was punctured on the bottom by a nail from the skid. the drum was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: while moving drums in warehouse two drums (openhead) did not have gaskets and when picked up with drum clips from the forklift these drums leaked material onto the floor. The spill was cleaned up in house and everything was contained. The customer was notified about the importance in using gaskets.

item.title: Report E-2025040192
item.description:
Report E-2025040192

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: MARKLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon plastic jug due to a forklift accident that resulted in the jug being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040104
item.description:
Report E-2025040104

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-07
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8’-by-6’ area. They estimated that thirty (30) pounds of material were released due to a skid puncturing bags of product. There were two (2) impacted bags during the release. Hepaco personnel containerized the damaged bags into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum along with chemical pads. An additional 55-gallon poly drum was used to contain PPE. Hepaco personnel staged the generated waste onsite before departing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal

item.title: Report E-2025040083
item.description:
Report E-2025040083

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-05
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to the pail being punctured by wood chips after a pallet broke while in transit. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into two (2) 5-gallon poly drums. The damaged container was packaged into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
